capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to someone the other day and they mentioned that wood is typically a male-dominated field. And from what I've learned, it's actually true - wood is often associated with masculinity in many cultures. I mean, think about it, we have words like "woodman" or "lumberjack", which are pretty masculine-sounding names. But at the same time, I don't want to generalize too much and say that all people who work with wood are men, because that's not necessarily true.
